intro: Aspilia silphioides, commonly known as the silphioid false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has basal leaves that are typically lobed or divided, and its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a flat-topped cluster. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert or semi-arid environments. Aspilia silphioides is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
